meanings.definition: Scholiasts: scholars or commentators who write annotations or explanations on ancient texts.
meanings.sent1: The scholiasts meticulously analyzed the old manuscripts.
meanings.sent2: Many scholiasts dedicate their lives to studying ancient writings.
meanings.sent3: The scholiasts joked that deciphering the text was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a team of scholiasts, unraveling the hidden meanings.
meanings.sent5: The image of the scholiasts poring over the scrolls stayed with him.

meanings.definition: Scholiasts: individuals who study and interpret classical literature.
meanings.sent1: In the library, you can often find scholiasts engrossed in old books.
meanings.sent2: The group of scholiasts discussed the nuances of the ancient plays.
meanings.sent3: The scholiasts playfully argued about the best way to interpret the poem.
meanings.sent4: Her love for classical literature made her a natural scholiast.
meanings.sent5: The young scholar felt like a true scholiast when analyzing the epic tale.

meanings.definition: Scholiasts: experts who provide critical notes or commentary on literary works.
meanings.sent1: The scholiasts' annotations helped students understand the complex text.
meanings.sent2: As a scholiast, she offered valuable insights into the novel.
meanings.sent3: The scholiasts humorously debated the author's intentions in the story.
meanings.sent4: His words were dissected by the sharp minds of the scholiasts.
meanings.sent5: The room buzzed with excitement as the scholiasts shared their analyses.
